forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 56. South southeast wind 20 to 28 mph, with gusts as high as 44 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 18 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the evening unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere is laden with the unmistakable scent of rain, promising a night dedicated to the soft, rhythmic patter of droplets against rooftops and sidewalk cafes. With the temperatures dipping to a cozy 56 degrees, the cityscape shrouded in clouds hints at a tranquil, yet slightly tempestuous charm. The brisk south-southeast winds whip through the streets, their gusts echoing the secrets of the Bay as they reach up to 44 mph, a forceful reminder of nature's authority. Here, amid the urban sprawl, fog lurks just beyond, hinting at the embrace of the marine layer that often characterizes this iconic landscape, softening the outlines of the Golden Gate and blurring the edges of the familiar skyline.

Tomorrow, as dawn breaks, the rain will persist, meeting a high of around 62 degrees before retreating into the cooler embrace of the afternoon. The remnants of the summer sun will gradually fade, leaving a canvas for the clouds to dance against the fading light. It would be wise to bundle up; perhaps a sturdy rain jacket layered over a comfortable sweater will suffice to ward off the chill as one navigates the weather. Given these conditions, a cozy evening could be best spent indoors—perhaps browsing the aisles of a local bookstore or savoring a warm cup of tea at a tucked-away café, embracing the peace that the rain brings to the city. Alternatively, for those willing to brave the elements, a brisk walk along the waterfront might unveil striking views shrouded in mist, a hidden beauty only available to those undeterred by a little weather.
